message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SI, cs.CL 

The paper introduces a new online learning algorithm for contextual bandits that leverages deep learning architectures, specifically Gated Linear Networks (GLNs). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), which is focused on the development of algorithms and models for learning from data. Additionally, the paper also discusses the properties of GLNs, which are a type of neural network, so cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the convergence properties of the algorithm, which falls under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Furthermore, the paper evaluates the algorithm on a standard benchmark suite of contextual bandit problems, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper also discusses the use of deep learning for natural language processing, which falls under the sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language).
